intro: Phyllanthus rangachariarii, commonly known as the Rangacharii spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the Indian subcontinent and is typically found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
